meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a sharp sound or series of sharp sounds as a result of striking hard objects together.
meanings.sent1: I clack the sticks together to make music.
meanings.sent2: The door clacked shut behind me.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys clacked the coconuts like drums.
meanings.sent4: Her heels clacked on the marble floor.
meanings.sent5: The clacking of the typewriter filled the room with rhythm.

meanings.definition: A sharp sound or series of sharp sounds as a result of striking hard objects together.
meanings.sent1: The clack of the billiard balls echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clack of the train wheels on the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The clack of the castanets added a lively beat to the music.
meanings.sent4: The clack of the hammer signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The clack of the dominoes falling was oddly satisfying.
